thread.title: Jackson scores 20, leads Pistons over Bulls
thread.title_full: Jackson scores 20, leads Pistons over Bulls

author: detroitnews.com
title: Jackson scores 20, leads Pistons over Bulls
text:
Detroit Pistons guard Reggie Jackson, (1) drives to the basket as Chicago Bulls guard Arron Brooks looks on during the first half of an NBA preseason basketball game on Wednesday, Oct. 14, 2015, in Chicago. The Pistons won 114-91.  Nam Y. Huh, AP Fullscreen Detroit Pistons forward Stanley Johnson, right, drives to the basket against Chicago Bulls forward Taj Gibson during the first half.  Nam Y. Huh, AP Fullscreen Detroit Pistons guard Reggie Jackson, left, drives against Chicago Bulls guard Jimmy Butler during the first half.  Nam Y. Huh, AP Fullscreen Chicago Bulls center/forward Joakim Noah (13) drives against Detroit Pistons center Andre Drummond during the first half.  Nam Y. Huh, AP Fullscreen Pistons' Stanley Johnson tiries to get off a shot around Bulls' Taj Gibson.  Jonathan Daniel, Getty Images Fullscreen Detroit Pistons forward Anthony Tolliver (43) and guard Reggie Jackson (1) block a shot by Chicago Bulls guard E'Twaun Moore during the first half .  Nam Y. You may also like these photo galleries: Replay Autoplay Show Thumbnails Show Captions Last Slide Next Slide Jodie Meeks of the Pistons moves around Jordan Crawford of the Bulls. (Photo: Jonathan Daniel / Getty Images) 
6 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Chicago — Reggie Jackson had 20 points and Marcus Morris and Reggie Bullock added 17 each to lead the Detroit Pistons to a 114-91 victory over the Chicago Bulls on Wednesday night in an exhibition game.
For the Pistons, Jackson was 7 for 15 from the field. Bullock, who was 7 of 8 from the field, had 12 points in the fourth quarter. Andre Drummond had 14 points and 10 rebounds.
For the Bulls, E’Twaun Moore had a team-high 16 points. Aaron Brooks had 13 points off the bench and rookie Bobby Portis had 11 points in 21 minutes. Taj Gibson (left ankle surgery) made his exhibition debut, finishing with four points and two rebounds in 10 first-half minutes.
